title: Two and a Half Men
overview: Charlie is a well-to-do bachelor with a house at the beach, a Jaguar in the front, and an easy way with women. His casual Malibu lifestyle is interrupted when his tightly wound brother Alan, who's facing a divorce, and his son Jake, come to live with him. Together, these two and a half men confront the challenges of growing up; finally. Complicating matters are the brothers' self-obsessed, controlling mother, Evelyn, Alan's estranged wife, Judith and Charlie's crazy neighbor Rose, who wants to be a part of his life and is willing to do anything to be around. After the death of his brother, Alan Harper meets and befriends a lonely young man named Walden Schmidt who turns out to be a billionaire. Unable to afford his brother's home, Alan sells Walden the house, and as a way of showing his gratitude, Walden allows Alan and his son Jake to move in with him.

top_episodes.title: I Think I Banged Lucille Ball
On Vodka, On Soda, On Blender, On Mixer!
Mr. Walden, He Die. I Clean Room.

episodes.title: Nangnangnangnang
episodes.overview: Charlie's 25-year-old daughter arrives at the beach house, hoping to get to know her family.

episodes.title: I Think I Banged Lucille Ball
episodes.overview: When Walden feels cramped in his own house, Jenny moves in with Evelyn and her boyfriend, Marty. Meanwhile, Alan becomes Lyndsey’s "other man".

episodes.title: This Unblessed Biscuit
episodes.overview: When Berta hurts her back at work, Alan and Walden think she should retire.

episodes.title: Clank, Clank, Drunken Skank
episodes.overview: Walden starts partying with Jenny and her hot friends. Meanwhile, Alan and Lyndsey’s illicit affair is jeopardized.

episodes.title: Alan Harper, Pleasing Women Since 2003
episodes.overview: Alan tries to find out what Lyndsey's boyfriend has over him; Walden helps Jenny pursue her acting career.

episodes.title: Justice in Star-Spangled Hot Pants
episodes.overview: Alan wants to set up a date with Lynda Carter once he learns Walden knows her; Walden begrudgingly agrees to invite Lynda over for dinner.

episodes.title: Some Kind of Lesbian Zombie
episodes.overview: Lyndsey's jealousy disrupts Walden's and Alan's dates with beautiful women.

episodes.title: Mr. Walden, He Die. I Clean Room.
episodes.overview: When Alan and Lyndsey's affair puts Walden in danger, he is forced to accept Rose's (Melanie Lynskey) help.

episodes.title: Numero Uno Accidente Lawyer
episodes.overview: Walden goes on a date with an accident-prone model; Alan's date reveals surprising personal information.

episodes.title: On Vodka, On Soda, On Blender, On Mixer!
episodes.overview: Jake sends Alan a Japanese delicacy; the house comes alive with questionable Christmas lyrics.

episodes.title: Tazed in the Lady Nuts
episodes.overview: Walden teams up with a beautiful former employee (Odette Annable) on a new project; Alan gives Jenny advice about her girlfriend (Aly Michalka).

episodes.title: Baseball.  Boobs.  Boobs.  Baseball.
episodes.overview: Alan lets Lyndsey’s boyfriend Larry set him up on a date.  Meanwhile, Walden offers to help Nicole with her software project so she’ll have time to date him

episodes.title: Bite Me, Supreme Court
episodes.overview: Marty Pepper (Carl Reiner) proposes to Evelyn; Alan and Walden plan a bachelor party for Marty.

episodes.title: Three Fingers of Creme De Menthe
episodes.overview: Alan is upset when he discovers that Lyndsey broke up with Larry and kept this information from him. When Walden’s masculinity is questioned he decides to prove he is a real man.

episodes.title: Cab Fare and a Bottle of Penicillin
episodes.overview: Alan gives Lyndsey the option of choosing between him and Larry. Meanwhile, Jenny fears she and Brooke are growing apart.

episodes.title: How to Get Rid of Alan Harper
episodes.overview: Walden suspects his new girlfriend is cheating on him. Meanwhile, Alan gets even more intertwined in Lyndsey and Larry's relationship when he starts dating Larry's sister, Gretchen.

episodes.title: Welcome Home, Jake
episodes.overview: Lyndsey discovers that Alan is sleeping with Larry's sister, Gretchen. Meanwhile, Walden struggles with telling Barry to find his own place.

episodes.title: I Changed My Mind About the Milk
episodes.overview: Walden plans a big surprise for Zoey's birthday.

episodes.title: A Big Bag of Dog
episodes.overview: Walden has a breakdown after his relationship with Zoey ends.

episodes.title: Four Balls, Two Bats and One Mitt
episodes.overview: Lyndsey and Alan try to add a little excitement to their love life.

episodes.title: You Do Know What the Lollipop Is For
episodes.overview: A friend's visiting daughter makes Walden feel his age.

episodes.title: That's Not What They Call It In Amsterdam
episodes.overview: Walden ignores Alan's warnings and starts dating Rose.

episodes.title: Ferrets, Attack
episodes.overview: Walden must choose between Zoey and Rose.

episodes.title: Avoid the Chinese Mustard
episodes.overview: When Walden gets tired of the complications that come with a traditional relationship, he hires an actress to be his girlfriend; Jake plans a rendezvous with Missi (Miley Cyrus) at the beach house.

episodes.title: Something My Gynecologist Said
episodes.overview: Alan feels reluctant to make a commitment to Lyndsey, but an unexpected source inspires him; Walden enjoys being the boy-toy of a wealthy older woman.

episodes.title: I Scream When I Pee
episodes.overview: Alans famous ex-wife, Kandi, wants to reconcile; when Berta isn't interested in celebrating her birthday, Walden tries to make her day special.

episodes.title: One Nut Johnson
episodes.overview: Alan helps Walden create a new identity so he can avoid women who are only interested in his money.

episodes.title: Give Santa a Tail-Hole
episodes.overview: Walden juggles his two identities; Alan ends up alone on Christmas.

episodes.title: Welcome to Alancrest
episodes.overview: Alan invests Walden's money in Kate's fashion line; leading a double life takes its toll on Walden.

episodes.title: Grab a Feather and Get in Line
episodes.overview: Alan and Walden go to Kate's fashion show in New York so Walden can reveal the truth about his identity.

episodes.title: Run, Steven Staven! Run!
episodes.overview: Alan is faced with relationship trouble when he does not give Lyndsey a key to the beach house; Walden, Alan, Herb and Billy commiserate about relationships.

episodes.title: Paint It, Pierce It or Plug It
episodes.overview: When Jake brings his 36-year-old girlfriend home for a visit, Alan is concerned; Walden tries to hide something from Alan.

episodes.title: Advantage: Fat, Flying Baby
episodes.overview: Depressed on Valentine's Day, Walden tries to talk Kate into giving him another chance; Alan's holiday plans go south.

episodes.title: Throgwarten Middle School Mysteries
episodes.overview: When Walden runs into his ex and they start talking about getting back together, Alan worries that she is not good enough.

episodes.title: The 9:04 from Pemberton
episodes.overview: After a fight with Walden, Alan decides to move in with Herb.

episodes.title: Big Episode. Someone Stole a Spoon
episodes.overview: Alan and Walden end up partying too hard as they try to cheer up Herb.

episodes.title: Bazinga! That's from a TV Show
episodes.overview: Walden and Alan are caught in the crossfire when Jake cheats on his girlfriend (Jaime Pressly) with her 18-year-old daughter.

episodes.title: Another Night with Neil Diamond
episodes.overview: Alan has a difficult time coping when Lyndsey breaks up with him.

episodes.title: My Bodacious Vidalia
episodes.overview: With encouragement from Walden, Alan decides to update his look; Alan is faced with a moral dilemma when he attracts a married woman.

episodes.title: Cows, Prepare to be Tipped
episodes.overview: Walden dates an attractive 22-year-old (Hilary Duff), but ends up being more interested in her grandmother (Marilu Henner); Jake and Alan go on a trip.

episodes.title: Nice to Meet You, Walden Schmidt
episodes.overview: Alan and Jake meet Walden Schmidt, a broken-hearted billionaire.

episodes.title: People Who Love Peepholes
episodes.overview: Walden deals with his ex-wife, Bridget.

episodes.title: Big Girls Don't Throw Food
episodes.overview: Alan prepares Walden for a date with Bridget, while Jake decides to emulate Walden and drop out of school.

episodes.title: Nine Magic Fingers
episodes.overview: Walden goes looking for Mrs. Right while Alan has an opportunity to reconcile with Lyndsey.

episodes.title: A Giant Cat Holding a Churro
episodes.overview: Alan has trouble accepting Lyndsey's seedy movie past, and Walden tries to cheer him up by throwing a party.

episodes.title: The Squat and the Hover
episodes.overview: Walden receives divorce papers from Bridget, but forgets his depression when he meets a girl who looks eerily like her.

episodes.title: Those Fancy Japanese Toilets
episodes.overview: Jake has a crush on his chemistry tutor, who has a crush on Walden. Meanwhile, Alan obsesses over the journal his brother left him in his will.

episodes.title: Thank You for the Intercourse
episodes.overview: When Walden begins redecorating the beach house, Alan becomes overly emotional.

episodes.title: Frodo's Headshots
episodes.overview: Upon his release from the hospital, Alan is met with a slew of challenges that test his ability to cope.

episodes.title: A Fishbowl Full of Glass Eyes
episodes.overview: Walden hits it off with a British babe, but neither of them is sure he's ready to re-enter the dating world.

episodes.title: What a Lovely Landing Strip
episodes.overview: Walden is trying his best to impress his new love interest when Bridget reappears in his life.

episodes.title: One False Move, Zimbabwe!
episodes.overview: Walden's mother arrives and Alan is smitten with her, even as she reveals a secret about Walden's past that sends him into a downward spiral.

episodes.title: Slowly and in a Circular Fashion
episodes.overview: Walden’s ex-wife and mother try to take control of his company, so he turns to Alan for help.

episodes.title: A Possum On Chemo
episodes.overview: Zoey tries to convince Walden to cut his hair and shave; Alan and Lyndsey revive their relationship.

episodes.title: The Duchess of Dull-in-Sack
episodes.overview: Walden tries to loosen Zooey up by sharing some of Berta's special brownies.

episodes.title: Sips, Sonnets and Sodomy
episodes.overview: When a huge storm keeps Walden, Alan, Zoey and Lindsay at home on Valentine's Day, conflict brews and relationships are strained.

episodes.title: Not in My Mouth!
episodes.overview: A near-death experience has an adverse effect on Zoey and Walden's relationship; Alan thinks Lyndsey may have a drinking problem.

episodes.title: The War Against Gingivitis
episodes.overview: Walden's ex-business partner shows up at the beach house looking to make peace.

episodes.title: Palmdale, Ech
episodes.overview: Alan and Lyndsey introduce their mothers. Jake and Eldridge get a ride from Walden to a party.

episodes.title: Grandma's Pie
episodes.overview: Walden breaks the news to Zoey that he is going into business with his ex-wife. Alan and Lyndsey try to cope with their mom's relationship.

episodes.title: Mr. Hose Says 'Yes'
episodes.overview: Zoey and her daughter move in with Walden; Alan gets more than he bargained for with Lyndsey.

episodes.title: Why We Gave Up Women
episodes.overview: Charlie's ghost pays a visit to Alan after he suffers a minor heart attack.

episodes.title: The Straw in My Donut Hole
episodes.overview: Zoey isn't convinced Alan deserves all the love and affection he receives upon his return from the hospital.

episodes.title: Oh Look! Al-Qaeda!
episodes.overview: Jake graduates and must decide what to do with his life.

episodes.title: Three Girls and a Guy Named Bud
episodes.overview: When Jake finds out that Alan has been dating Eldridge's mom, he packs up and heads to Judith and Herb's. Meanwhile, Charlie decides it's time to cut back on boozing.

episodes.title: A Bottle of Wine and a Jackhammer
episodes.overview: Charlie is willing to do anything for Alan to accept Lyndsey's offer to move in with her.

episodes.title: A Pudding-Filled Cactus
episodes.overview: After moving in with Lyndsey, Alan continues to have a rendezvous with Melissa at Charlie's house.

episodes.title: Hookers, Hookers, Hookers
episodes.overview: Lyndsey and Eldridge move into Charlie's house after their home burns down.

episodes.title: The Immortal Mr. Billy Joel
episodes.overview: Alan pretends to be Charlie when he goes out on the town; Charlie sneaks off for cosmetic surgery.

episodes.title: Twanging Your Magic Clanger
episodes.overview: Charlie has difficulty dealing with dating a slightly older woman.

episodes.title: The Crazy Bitch Gazette
episodes.overview: Charlie's girlfriend gets fed up with his stalker, Rose.

episodes.title: Springtime on a Stick
episodes.overview: Charlie and Alan try to set up Evelyn with Russell the pharmacist.

episodes.title: A Good Time in Central Africa
episodes.overview: When Berta takes a couple of days off, Charlie falls for her replacement. Meanwhile, Alan believes he's being stalked by Lyndsey's ex-husband.

episodes.title: Ow, Ow, Don't Stop
episodes.overview: When Charlie's ex-girlfriend Courtney is released from prison, he treats her to the good life despite her having been in prison for conning him.

episodes.title: Dead from the Waist Down
episodes.overview: Alan goes to great lengths to be able to get Lyndsey a nice birthday present.

episodes.title: Chocolate Diddlers or My Puppy's Dead
episodes.overview: Depressed after his breakup from Courtney (Jenny McCarthy), Charlie goes to see his psychiatrist (Jane Lynch).

episodes.title: Skunk, Dog, Crap and Ketchup
episodes.overview: Alan feels paranoid when Lyndsey becomes friendly with Charlie.

episodes.title: Lookin' for Japanese Subs
episodes.overview: Obsessed and believing her to be married, Charlie starts stalking Rose. Jake and Eldridge start taping themselves doing Jackass-style stunts.

episodes.title: Three Hookers and a Philly Cheesesteak
episodes.overview: While Charlie and Rose carry on their "affair," Alan's chiropractic business turns into a Ponzi scheme.

episodes.title: That Darn Priest
episodes.overview: Rose and Alan discover each other's secrets. Meanwhile, Charlie's desperate to get some time alone with Rose.

episodes.title: 818-JKLPUZO
episodes.overview: Charlie must make a difficult decision about his future and with which woman he wants to spend his life: Chelsea or Mia.

episodes.title: Whipped Unto the Third Generation
episodes.overview: When Chelsea convinces Charlie to let Alan's new girlfriend, Melissa, move in, the girls end up taking over Charlie's house.

episodes.title: Mmm, Fish. Yum.
episodes.overview: Alan ends up playing maid to Judith's new baby as well as his former mother-in-law. Meanwhile, Jake uses an incriminating photo to blackmail Charlie.

episodes.title: Laxative Tester, Horse Inseminator
episodes.overview: Alan starts working for Evelyn as Charlie works to fix the relationship between Chelsea and Jake.

episodes.title: For the Sake of the Child
episodes.overview: Jake stops at nothing to get away from Charlie and Alan, after they embarrass him out in public.

episodes.title: Give Me Your Thumb
episodes.overview: Alan's advice to Chelsea that she get breast-reduction surgery is not met with enthusiasm by Charlie, who kicks him out, but staying with Evelyn has its own challenges.

episodes.title: Untainted By Filth
episodes.overview: Alan and Charlie are shocked when they wake up next to a strange woman, and try to find out what happened.

episodes.title: Gorp. Fnark. Schmegle.
episodes.overview: While overcoming a bad break-up, Chelsea invites her beautiful college roommate to stay at the house.

episodes.title: Captain Terry's Spray-On Hair
episodes.overview: Charlie discovers he has not been satisfying Chelsea; Alan attempts to cure his thinning hair without spending much money.

episodes.title: That's Why They Call It Ball Room
episodes.overview: Charlie discovers that Chelsea has not been completely honest about her finances.

episodes.title: Warning, It's Dirty
episodes.overview: Jake is taught the art of infidelity by Charlie, whose girlfriend is away for Christmas.

episodes.title: Fart Jokes, Pie and Celeste
episodes.overview: Jake hopes to win back Celeste by writing her love songs. Alan and Herb hope to keep Judith from finding out they've become friends.

episodes.title: Yay, No Polyps!
episodes.overview: Charlie opts to have a colonoscopy in order to avoid going on a trip with Chelsea to see her parents. However, when he returns home, he finds her parents at his house.

episodes.title: Crude and Uncalled For
episodes.overview: Charlie suspects Chelsea likes the lawyer representing Alan after his arrest for a bar fight.

episodes.title: Aye, Aye, Captain Douche
episodes.overview: Chelsea and Charlie's relationship is at risk when Charlie's jealousy comes between them.

episodes.title: Tinkle Like a Princess
episodes.overview: Charlie runs off to Vegas and returns with a new wife, but she's not Chelsea.

episodes.title: I Found Your Moustache
episodes.overview: Charlie and Chelsea have a post-breakup one-night stand.

episodes.title: Ixnay on the Oggie Day
episodes.overview: Charlie has a return engagement with Chelsea's best friend, while Alan has an unexpected effect on a new female patient.

episodes.title: Keith Moon Is Vomiting in His Grave
episodes.overview: Alan is torn between the bad influence of Jake's new friend and the hotness of his mother.

episodes.title: I Called Him Magoo
episodes.overview: Alan tries for an intimate night at a hotel with his new girlfriend, while Charlie takes a different approach to obtain the "girlfriend experience"

episodes.title: Gumby with a Pokey
episodes.overview: Charlie is visited by the ghosts of his ex-girlfriends while Alan and Jake are on a road trip.

episodes.title: This Is Not Gonna End Well
episodes.overview: Charlie is miffed over Alan's planned attendance of Chelsea's birthday party and suffers the indignity of having Jake chauffer him around following a license suspension.

episodes.title: Taterhead Is Our Love Child
episodes.overview: In the 6th season opener, Charlie runs into an ex-girlfriend (Rena Sofer) and a child who bears a striking resemblance to Charlie.

episodes.title: Pie Hole, Herb
episodes.overview: Charlie borrowed money from Alan and on the day he is supposed to pay him back, Alan goes to ask Charlie for the money. He again finds Charlie in bed with a beautiful woman. After Charlie shoos him out and assures him he'll get the money for him later that day, the woman asks if Charlie is really out of cash and Charlie tells her not to worry, that he has plenty of hooker money.

episodes.title: Damn You, Eggs Benedict
episodes.overview: Alan, Jake, and Charlie all decide to try new things: Alan is dating more than one woman, Charlie learns to cook, and Jake experiments with beer.

episodes.title: The Flavin' and the Mavin'
episodes.overview: Alan is sure that things will turn bad when Charlie starts dating his receptionist.

episodes.title: A Jock Strap in Hell
episodes.overview: Charlie tries to help Jake's former teacher, who became a stripper after dating him, but things go from bad to worse when she has a religious conversion.

episodes.title: It's Always Nazi Week
episodes.overview: When Judith kicks Herb to the curb, Alan comes knocking; Jake is sent to stay with a less-than-willing Charlie for three months during Judith's meltdown.

episodes.title: Best H.O. Money Can Buy
episodes.overview: Alan tries to get away from Judith. Meanwhile, Charlie and Herb go out on the town.

episodes.title: Pinocchio's Mouth
episodes.overview: Charlie's new girlfriend Chelsea asks him to spend the night at her place, which puts Charlie well outside of his comfort zone, while Alan tries to enforce a punishment on Jake initiated by Judith for mooning a group of girls.

episodes.title: The Mooch At the Boo
episodes.overview: Charlie finds himself in an uncomfortable position when Jake takes off with the daughter of a former NFL player. Charlie's Mercedes proves a boon to Alan's love life.

episodes.title: He Smelled the Ham, He Got Excited
episodes.overview: Evelyn offers to pay for Jake's college education, and Alan becomes listless because he has no compelling reason to work anymore, while Jake discovers a hidden talent in the culinary arts that may allow him to bypass college altogether.

episodes.title: The Devil's Lube
episodes.overview: Charlie finds himself re-examining his wild ways when an old friend dies and begins to feel that his time on Earth may be drawing to a close.

episodes.title: Thank God for Scoliosis
episodes.overview: Charlie and Jake fight for the affections of a waitress, while Alan fights sexual tension with his receptionist.

episodes.title: I Think You Offended Don
episodes.overview: Judith is pregnant with a baby girl and Alan is convinced he is the father.

episodes.title: David Copperfield Slipped Me a Roofie
episodes.overview: Melissa doesn't think Alan's family appreciates him, so she asks him to move in with her and her mom.

episodes.title: I'd Like to Start With the Cat
episodes.overview: Charlie ends up in couples counseling.

episodes.title: She'll Still Be Dead At Halftime
episodes.overview: Charlie has to remove a half-naked woman from his bedroom before Chelsea arrives.

episodes.title: The 'Ocu' or the 'Pado'?
episodes.overview: Charlie's admission that he's in love with Chelsea gets a surprising reaction from her

episodes.title: My Son's Enormous Head
episodes.overview: Chelsea's illness gives Charlie a chance to prove he can take care of her, but also yearning to run away from the situation.

episodes.title: The Two Finger Rule
episodes.overview: After Chelsea discovers a nude picture of another woman on Charlie's cell phone, he blows off steam by going out for a night of drinking with Alan, Herb and his neighbor.

episodes.title: Hello, I am Alan Cousteau
episodes.overview: Charlie's desperate to make sure Chelsea and Evelyn don't befriend each other following their first meeting.

episodes.title: Above Exalted Cyclops
episodes.overview: Chelsea is asked by Alan to arrange a blind date between he and her new friend, unaware that her new friend is Rose.

episodes.title: Sir Lancelot's Litter Box
episodes.overview: Charlie mourns the loss of his bachelor pad as he reluctantly allows Chelsea to move in. Meanwhile, Alan discovers there is no longer much space left in the house for him.

episodes.title: Good Morning, Mrs. Butterworth
episodes.overview: Alan and Chelsea become best buds, and Charlie decides to take advantage of the situation.

episodes.title: Baseball Was Better With Steroids
episodes.overview: Charlie starts to question his relationship with Chelsea when he hears that Mia is back in town. Meanwhile, Judith goes into labor and Charlie, Alan and Herb rush her to the hospital, on the sixth season finale.

episodes.title: Large Birds, Spiders and Mom
episodes.overview: Jake is getting ready to start a new school as he graduates to Junior High. Alan and Charlie take him school shopping and find themselves in trouble.

episodes.title: Media Room Slash Dungeon
episodes.overview: Charlie acts strange after spending an evening with his mother, and a woman Alan slept with behaves oddly the next morning.

episodes.title: Dum Diddy Dum Diddy Doo
episodes.overview: Alan convinces Charlie that he needs to date more respectable women and sets him up with a judge. The two double date and their waitress happens to be one of Alan's ex-girlfriends. Charlie's date backfires the following morning, when he ends up in court in front of the judge.

episodes.title: City of Great Racks
episodes.overview: Charlie and Linda get closer to consummating their relationship, but Charlie has trouble focusing when he begins to see Rose's face everywhere he turns.

episodes.title: Putting Swim Fins On a Cat
episodes.overview: Charlie has to come up with ways to keep his girlfriend's 4-year-old amused; Alan becomes a test subject.

episodes.title: Help Daddy Find His Toenail
episodes.overview: Charlie's girlfriend is embrassed to go out in public with him. Meanwhile, Jake sneaks out to attend a concert.

episodes.title: The Leather Gear Is In the Guest Room
episodes.overview: After Alan and Charlie have a fight about Alan's role in the house. Alan packs Jake up and moves in with his mother.

episodes.title: Is There a Mrs. Waffles?
episodes.overview: Charlie writes a children’s song and finds success as Charlie Waffles. The children love him and the mothers seem to as well. Charlie's new found fame irritates Alan.

episodes.title: Tight's Good
episodes.overview: Charlie fights his attraction for Teddy's daughter.

episodes.title: Kinda Like Necrophilia
episodes.overview: Alan finds out that Charlie stole his girlfriend and works on a plan to get back at Charlie, even though this happened when they were in high school.

episodes.title: Meander to Your Dander
episodes.overview: When Alan finds himself wanting to break up with a woman, Charlie offers his expertise.

episodes.title: A Little Clammy and None Too Fresh
episodes.overview: Rose returns from England, and plays nurse rather oddly for an ill Charlie.

episodes.title: The Soil Is Moist
episodes.overview: Alan finds out some surprising information about Judith's sex life when he decides to go on a date with one of her friends.

episodes.title: Winky-Dink Time
episodes.overview: Charlie double-dates with Jake and fixes Alan up with a hooker.

episodes.title: Rough Night In Hump Junction
episodes.overview: Alan feels Charlie is unable to control his womanizing ways.

episodes.title: Look At Me, Mommy, I'm Pretty
episodes.overview: Alan makes wedding plans for Evelyn and Teddy, while Charlie figures out how to get more acquainted with his future step-sister.

episodes.title: Fish In a Drawer
episodes.overview: CSI's investigate a death at Charlie's house.

episodes.title: If My Hole Could Talk
episodes.overview: Charlie's attracted to an older self-help author. Alan and Jake clash over a project for school.

episodes.title: Waiting for the Right Snapper
episodes.overview: When Charlie meets Angie's soon to be daughter-in-law, he realizes it's not for the first time.

episodes.title: Working for Caligula
episodes.overview: Charlie returns to his bachelor lifestyle after Alan moves out of the house. Alan suffers a breakdown after his divorce from Kandi.

episodes.title: Who's Vod Kanockers?
episodes.overview: Charlie finally tells Alan the truth about why he did not marry Mia. Charlie and Alan deal with a noisy neighbour.

episodes.title: The Sea Is a Harsh Mistress
episodes.overview: Charlie tries to surf to impress Dottie, a beautiful woman he just met, but after he nearly drowns he is convinced that he saw his late father.

episodes.title: A Pot Smoking Monkey
episodes.overview: Alan tries to hire his ex-wife's lawyer to help him win custody over the dog he and Kandi shared.

episodes.title: A Live Woman of Proven Fertility
episodes.overview: Alan is overjoyed by the prospect of Judith remarrying, as he would no longer have to pay alimony. Alan gets Charlie to help him when it looks like the marriage may be derailed due to Jake’s dislike of his mother’s fiancé.

episodes.title: Apologies for the Frivolity
episodes.overview: Charlie is dating a woman whose personality and life are like his mother’s.

episodes.title: Repeated Blows to His Unformed Head
episodes.overview: Berta's daughter, Naomi, is pregnant and Berta drags Charlie with her when she confronts the baby’s father. Alan reveals a secret fetish.

episodes.title: Release the Dogs
episodes.overview: Alan suffers from insomnia. He visits his psychiatrist (Jane Lynch), who reveals that the cause of Alan's sleepless nights is his jealousy towards Charlie, and his inability to glide through life.

episodes.title: Corey's Been Dead for an Hour
episodes.overview: Charlie gets tired of Alan's mooching and reaches the breaking point during the brothers' double date. Jake is left home alone for the first time.

episodes.title: Kissing Abe Lincoln
episodes.overview: Charlie must choose between his girlfriend and his housekeeper; Alan looks to sell Kandi's condo, but sex keeps getting in the way.

episodes.title: Walnuts and Demerol
episodes.overview: Charlie's friends and family put a crimp in his plan for a romantic Christmas Eve date. When Evelyn sees who the date is, she goes to great lengths to force a wedge between them.

episodes.title: Castrating Sheep in Montana
episodes.overview: Berta discovers that Alan has been dating her daughter (Sara Rue).

episodes.title: Don't Worry, Speed Racer
episodes.overview: When Jake tells Charlie and Alan that he often overhears Judith and Herb (Ryan Stiles) making out, it triggers a repressed memory for Charlie.

episodes.title: That's Summer Sausage, Not Salami
episodes.overview: Charlie has second thoughts after setting Alan up with their new neighbor (Brooke Shields)..

episodes.title: My Damn Stalker
episodes.overview: Rose is moving to London, and Charlie is surprised by his reaction to the news. Alan lies to a woman he met online.

episodes.title: Young People Have Phlegm Too
episodes.overview: Charlie's young, hot girlfriend takes him to a new club. She invites Alan to meet one of her friends but the men are shocked to learn that they are considered as being "old".

episodes.title: I Merely Slept With a Commie
episodes.overview: After Evelyn tells Alan and Charlie how she feels about there being no mourners at her friend’s funeral, the boys share their feelings that this could also be the case at her funeral. Evelyn tries to prove them wrong by introducing them to a couple she help adopt a boy from China. The boys return fire by inviting the young man to a play date with Jake.

episodes.title: It Never Rains In Hooterville
episodes.overview: Alan tries to bond with Jake when he realizes that his childhood is almost over. Kandi pursues a career in acting.

episodes.title: Smooth As a Ken Doll
episodes.overview: Charlie takes a liking to Myra, the witty sister of Judith's fiancé, Herb.

episodes.title: Aunt Myra Doesn't Pee a Lot
episodes.overview: Alan looks forward to Judith's wedding, while Charlie and Myra continue their romance.

episodes.title: Tucked, Taped and Gorgeous
episodes.overview: Alan and Charlie re-examine their sexual identities after Alan befriends Greg, a gay man. Meanwhile, Jake has a crush on Greg's daughter.

episodes.title: Mr. McGlue's Feedbag
episodes.overview: Jake gets lucky after Charlie takes him to the racetrack. Meanwhile, Alan has a difficult time at the DMV.

episodes.title: Anteaters. They're Just Crazy-Lookin
episodes.overview: Charlie is shocked when the handyman working on his house beats him out for Chloe's affections. Alan has no sympathy for Charlie’s distress.

episodes.title: Prostitutes and Gelato
episodes.overview: Evelyn's boyfriend, Teddy, invites Alan and Charlie to go with him to Las Vegas on his private jet. The boys confront their individual 'daddy issues'

episodes.title: Weekend In Bangkok With Two Olympic Gymnasts
episodes.overview: After falling off the roof, Alan needs Charlie's help in looking after Jake, which interferes with Charlie's social life.

episodes.title: Principal Gallagher's Lesbian Lover
episodes.overview: Jake gets suspended from school after drawing an offensive picture of a girl in his class that has large breasts. Meanwhile, Charlie is asked to watch over Alan's chiropractic office after pulling an all-nighter.

episodes.title: Carpet Burns and a Bite Mark
episodes.overview: Alan has been dating a lot, and Charlie soon finds out that it has been one woman - his ex-wife, Judith. He tries to stop Alan, and even brings Rose, Evelyn and Berta to interfere - but Alan ignores them all.

episodes.title: Your Dismissive Attitude Toward Boobs
episodes.overview: Berta causes tension between Charlie and Alan, when she temporarily moves in with them

episodes.title: We Called It Mr. Pinky
episodes.overview: Charlie learns he can't be in a long-lasting relationship, becuase of unresolved issues he has with his mother. Jake asks Charlie for advice about a girl at school.

episodes.title: Hi, Mr. Horned One
episodes.overview: Ignoring Alan's warnings, Charlie continues to date Isabella until she threatens to put a curse on his manhood.

episodes.title: Sleep Tight, Puddin' Pop
episodes.overview: Charlie wakes up with Rose the morning after her birthday party. Her irate father (Martin Sheen), comes to ask Charlie about what the future holds for him and Rose, but the unexpected happens when Evelyn shows up.

episodes.title: That Voodoo That I Do Do
episodes.overview: Charlie tricks Jake into taking ballet lessons, so he can get close to the teacher.

episodes.title: Madame and Her Special Friend
episodes.overview: One of Charlie's elderly neighbors tries to seduce Alan, while Charlie tries to stop Jake from giving money to a televangelist.

episodes.title: Something Salted and Twisted
episodes.overview: Charlie helps Alan with his obsession of always having to get approval from the women in his life.

episodes.title: Santa's Village of the Damned
episodes.overview: Alan starts dating a woman with a Martha Stewart complex. Before long she's running the house with an obsession for perfection.

episodes.title: That Special Tug
episodes.overview: Charlie sees a therapist to learn how to deal with Alan's emotional insecurities.

episodes.title: Humiliation Is a Visual Medium
episodes.overview: Charlie finds himself in a relationship that is not based on sex.

episodes.title: Love Isn't Blind, It's Retarded
episodes.overview: Charlie arranges a romantic date with Mia in the hopes of consummating their relationship. Alan begins to date Charlie's most recent ex-girlfriend.

episodes.title: My Tongue is Meat
episodes.overview: Charlie has trouble keeping up with Mia's healthy lifestyle, so he begins to sneak beers, cigars, and burgers behind her back. When Mia finds out what he was doing, Charlie has to decide if he is truly in love with her or just whipped.

episodes.title: Ergo, the Booty Call
episodes.overview: Alan has trouble deciding if he should bring his younger girlfriend to Jake's birthday party to meet his mom and his ex-wife. Rose tries to get her boyfriend to act more like Charlie.

episodes.title: The Unfortunate Little Schnauser
episodes.overview: Charlie is nominated for an advertising award, but he decides to boycott it because his arch nemesis always wins. The rest of his family tries to trick him into going. Rose is having relationship problems with Gordon and seeks help from Charlie.

episodes.title: The Spit-Covered Cobbler
episodes.overview: Alan starts to have financial problems when he starts paying for his girlfriend's bills, so Charlie tries to get him to break up with her. Meanwhile, Judith is after Alan because he is late in paying his alimony check.

episodes.title: Golly Moses, She's a Muffin
episodes.overview: Charlie is surprised to find out that Kandi has been living with them for the last three weeks. Alan is having a tough time helping Kandi earn a living. Charlie has lost his sense because of the dry-spell he is going through.

episodes.title: Always a Bridesmaid, Never a Burro
episodes.overview: Alan tries to win Kandi back.  Meanwhile, Charlie starts to sleep with her mom, Mandi, and Judith gets set up with her father, Andy.

episodes.title: And the Plot Moistens
episodes.overview: Jake’s teacher has a meeting with Alan and Judith to discuss the lack of interest Jake has at school. Alan starts to fall for Francine, in a platonic way, because he is tired of the lack of intelligent communication he has with Kandi. Charlie helps Jake audition for his school musical.

episodes.title: Just Once With Aunt Sophie
episodes.overview: A girl from Jake’s school invites him to his first boy-girl party.  Charlie and Alan help him get ready for it by giving him advice. Alan and Charlie get nostalgic and remember their first boy-girl party.

episodes.title: Arguments for the Quickie
episodes.overview: Mia comes back to town with her dance troupe and invites Charlie to her performance. At first, he decides not to go and tries to convince Alan that he no longer has feelings for her. He goes to the see the performance and Mia explains that she wants some of Charlie’s sperm. Charlie responds by asking Mia for something.

episodes.title: That Pistol-Packin' Hermaphrodite
episodes.overview: Charlie and Mia start making their wedding arrangements.  Things begin to fall apart when their two families meet each other. They eventually decide on a small ceremony in Las Vegas.

episodes.title: Back Off, Mary Poppins
episodes.overview: Alan learns that Charlie belongs to an exclusive men's group, and he begs his brother to let him join.

episodes.title: Enjoy Those Garlic Balls
episodes.overview: Judith is dating Jake's pediatrician, and Alan is upset until Charlie points out that if she remarries, his alimony payments will end.

episodes.title: A Bag Full of Jawea
episodes.overview: Charlie tries to save Jake from school suspension for giving his teacher (Missi Pyle) the finger by romancing her, but his several attempts fail every time.

episodes.title: Go Get Mommy's Bra
episodes.overview: Jake is very impressed and can't stop talking about his mother's new boyfriend, Dr. Melnick, which annoys Alan.   While Evelyn borrows Charlie's car to help her impress a Saudi prince, because she wants to sell him real estate.  When Charlie gets his car back, he discovers his mother's bra in the backseat.  When he finds out why it's there he decides to trade in his car.

episodes.title: Bad News from the Clinic?
episodes.overview: Charlie meets his match when he falls for a woman who's better at playing hard to get than he is.

episodes.title: The Price of Healthy Gums Is Eternal Vigilance
episodes.overview: Alan denies having shoplifted a toy as a child and fears he has a dark side, until Charlie admits he planted the toy on Alan to stay out of trouble himself.

episodes.title: A Kosher Slaughterhouse Out In Fontana
episodes.overview: Charlie and Alan hire Berta's sister to cater a party their mother has conned them into throwing for her.

episodes.title: Frankenstein and the Horny Villagers
episodes.overview: Alan meets a woman named Nancy at a grocery store, who fulfills every single one of his desires, forcing Charlie to take care of Jake. After knowing Nancy for a few days Alan decides to ask her to marry him, prompting Charlie to try and talk him out of it, and he even gets help from the brothers' mother.

episodes.title: Yes, Monsignor
episodes.overview: When Charlie leaves the house to avoid a date that he can't stand, he ends up at a coffee shop, where he meets his old girlfriend Lisa.  He finds out that she broke up with her husband, and now has a child. Now he must try to convince Lisa that he's okay with her having a child.   While Jake tries to justify to his father why he isn't doing so well in school.

episodes.title: The Salmon Under My Sweater
episodes.overview: Charlie tries to get Jake's approval on a theme song that he is hired to write for a television show, which is based on a comic book that Jake is a fan. While Alan finds out  more about Rose (including how smart she is), when he spends more time with her.

episodes.title: Last Chance to See Those Tattoos
episodes.overview: After getting unusually turned down at a bar, Charlie learns that a website has been made dedicated to exposing his lifestyle. Charlie sets out to find who created the site, making amends to all those he stood up, but it's harder than it looks when all the women take the apology better than expected.

episodes.title: A Lungful of Alan
episodes.overview: Alan is jealous of Charlie when an old classmate, who's now a beautiful woman, seems to be more interested in Charlie.

episodes.title: Zejdz Zmoich Wlosow (Get Off My Hair)
episodes.overview: After an earthquake hits, Judith's house is damaged and she needs a place to stay. So Alan decides to invite her to stay with him and Charlie, without getting Charlie's permission.  Charlie isn't happy with this, but accepts it. Alan becomes jealous when Judith goes on a date, and asks Charlie to find him a date, so that he can show Judith that he dates as well.

episodes.title: Those Big Pink Things With Coconut
episodes.overview: The brothers throw out their mother, after she insults the way Alan is raising Jake.  When Alan and Charlie ignore her phone calls, to get their attention she ends up in the hospital.  When Alan and Charlie show up at the hospital they aren't sure if she's faking, and try to call her bluff.

episodes.title: Smell the Umbrella Stand
episodes.overview: Alan starts to worry about a medical procedure that he is facing, and to get his mind off it, Charlie suggests they go to Las Vegas.

episodes.title: Can You Eat Human Flesh With Wooden Teeth?
episodes.overview: When Judith decides to take a vacation, the brothers have to take care of Jake during the week.  Alan finds it challenging, and even forgets to pick up Jake from soccer practice.   When Alan finds out that he has to go to the I.R.S. because they're auditing him, he forces Charlie to take care of Jake, and Charlie doesn't do any better then Alan.

episodes.title: Woo-Hoo, a Hernia Exam!
episodes.overview: After Charlie has back pain, Alan decides to take him to the Hospital. While there Charlie can't stop hitting on the doctor who is examining him.  The only problem is that he has a history with her that he can't remember.   Berta is feed up with Jake's inability to use the bathroom properly, so she decides to make him clean it until he learns.

episodes.title: It Was 'Mame', Mom
episodes.overview: Charlie is invited to a party hosted by a gay ad-executive named Eric, so Charlie asks Alan to pretend that he's his life partner.  While at the party, Charlie meets Eric's ex-wife Pamela, and tries to sleep with her without Eric finding out.

episodes.title: A Low, Guttural Tongue-Flapping Noise
episodes.overview: After Charlie takes Alan to an eye doctor, they end up at cafe where they bump into Charlie's ex-girlfriend, Sherri. While there Alan shows an interest in Sherri, and decides to ask her out.   The problem is that Alan can't get over Sherri's relationship with Charlie.

episodes.title: I Always Wanted a Shaved Monkey
episodes.overview: Rose tries to help the brothers sort out their feelings, when Charlie and Alan take their personal frustrations out on each other.

episodes.title: A Sympathetic Crotch to Cry On
episodes.overview: Evelyn reads in the obituaries that her second husband, Harry has died. They all attend the funeral, including Jake who is excited at the opportunity of seeing a ""dead guy"". Charlie is excited by the opportunity of a newly single widow, and Alan is just happy to pay his respects to Harry.

episodes.title: That Old Hose Bag Is My Mother
episodes.overview: Evelyn buys Alan a new Sports car causing Charlie to claim that his brother has sold his soul to the Devil.  The next day, Evelyn extracts payment by insisting that Alan go on a blind, double date with her, her new beau and his daughter.  At the restaurant, Alan learns that his mother and boyfriend will not be able to join them because there was a mixup between his heart medication and Viagra and she didn't want to ""waste it"".  As a result, Alan is left to deal with the daughter, who is on a weekend pass from a rehab center and still has some loose screws.  Alan eventually gets her back to the beach house only to have her drive off in his new sports car and become the object of a televised high-speed car chase.

episodes.title: Squab, Squab, Squab, Squab, Squab
episodes.overview: Evelyn demands Jake spend a night at her place when she finds out he spent Spring Break with Judith's parents. Neither Alan nor Charlie are keen on the idea, but going to a bar after dropping off Jake quickly erases their concerns.

episodes.title: Does This Smell Funny to You?
episodes.overview: Charlie unknowingly sleeps with an older man's trophy wife while Jake has to read a paper to his class.

episodes.title: Pilot
episodes.overview: Charlie's life turns upside down when his brother and nephew move in; at the supermarket, Charlie discovers he can use 10-year-old Jake to attract women.

episodes.title: Big Flappy Bastards
episodes.overview: While spending time with Jake, Charlie finds it hard to enforce rules that Alan has set out for him.  It gets to the point were Jake lures a flock of sea gulls into his room, and Charlie gets very upset.  This prompts Jake to try and get Charlie to forgive him. Alan starts doing chores for Judith, in the hopes of them getting back together.  During one of the tasks, Judith kisses Alan, leading him to believe that things will get back to the way they once were.

episodes.title: Go East On Sunset Until You Reach the Gates of Hell
episodes.overview: After spending a day at Disneyland, Jake gets sick and wants to go to his mothers' house, to have her take care of him.  This sends Alan into a state of misery, as he realizes he's losing his wife, and son.  Charlie suggests that they go drinking, and Alan agrees. After drinking the boys take a cab home, but at one point they end up at their mothers, where they try to tell her what they think of her, but fail in getting the point across.

episodes.title: If I Can't Write My Chocolate Song, I'm Going to Take a Nap
episodes.overview: Charlie is very unhappy with his housekeepers' decision to quit, after she experiences Alan's demanding ways. Alan then offers to take on the role of housekeeper, but this situation doesn't work at all. So Alan decides to get the housekeeper to come back. Before Alan leaves, he puts Charlie in charge of getting Jake ready for a dinner with his mother and grandparents. Charlie also tries to get Rose to move on, and date other men. He finds both situations to be bigger challenges then he first thought.

episodes.title: The Last Thing You Want to Do Is Wind Up With a Hump
episodes.overview: After spending a night in Las Vegas, Charlie decides to live up to his promise that he made to Jake about attending his soccer game.  During the game, Charlie sets up a play-date with an unattached mother named Kate, and they hit it off.  During one of their dates, Charlie seems like he's ready for a serious relation.    Alan sets up a meeting with Gloria (one of the soccer moms) to write a soccer newsletter, but Gloria has other intentions for the evening, and he has no idea.  During the evening another soccer mom, Brooke, tries to move in on Gloria's plans.

episodes.title: Did You Check With the Captain of the Flying Monkeys?
episodes.overview: Charlie tries to teach Jake to avoid certain calls that Charlie doesn't want to deal with, like his mother (Evelyn) for one.  Evelyn gets so frustrated with not being able to talk to Charlie, that she decides to drop in while in the neighborhood.  She invites them to dinner, to meet her new boyfriend (Tommy). When the brothers get over to their mothers house, Charlie is shocked to realize that Tommy's daughter is Olivia, one of the people he has been avoiding. Olivia tries to confront Charlie about their situation, but doesn't get the answer she wants, and throws a drink in his face, then storms off. After a week of not being able to contact their mother, Alan gets worried about her.  So the brothers decide to go to her house and see if she's okay. They find her sitting in the dark and drinking, and she informs them that Tommy dumped her for a younger women.  Later the brothers get Jake to try and cheer her up.

episodes.title: If They Do Go Either Way, They're Usually Fake
episodes.overview: Judith gets worried when, for a school assignment, Jake draws the tattooed buttocks of a female surfer friend of Charlie's who is in the habit of walking around his place half naked.  Then Alan gets worried about Judith after she becomes friends with the surfer girl.

episodes.title: Twenty-Five Little Pre-pubers Without a Snootful
episodes.overview: Alan tricks Charlie into joining him and Judith in leading Jake and his classmates in the school's annual music show.

episodes.title: Phase One, Complete
episodes.overview: After meeting Wendy, a one-night stand of Charlies, Jake befriends her.  Charlie doesn't like this situation, as he believes Wendy is using Jake to further their relationship, and he has no intention to keep it going.  It gets to the point were Wendy even starts spending time with Evelyn, and Charlie becomes desperate to get rid of Wendy. After Charlie breaks it off Jake becomes very unhappy with him, because he won't be able to see Wendy anymore. This forces Charlie to confront Jake and explain the situation as best as he can. Rose sees that Alan knows how to play scrabble, and asks him to teach her to play, he agrees. During the scrabble games the two bond, and Charlie suspects that she is using Alan to get closer to him, but doesn't pursue the issue.

episodes.title: Merry Thanksgiving
episodes.overview: In an attempt to prove that he is a family man, Charlie invites Lisa over for Thanksgiving dinner

episodes.title: Alan Harper, Frontier Chiropractor
episodes.overview: While at the movies, the brothers bump into Judith and her new boyfriend.  Seeing that Judith has changed her look, and the fact that Jake doesn't think Alan is as cool as Judith; prompts Alan to realize that if he wants to get back into the dating scene, he's going to have to change his look as well.

episodes.title: Camel Filters + Pheromones
episodes.overview: When Berta is forced to bring her granddaughter Prudence to work with her, the boys find themselves a little preoccupied with her.

episodes.title: Sarah Like Puny Alan
episodes.overview: Charlie finally gets a chance for a double date with a hot neighbor, who is out for revenge on her cheating husband, and her sister who's a hot soap opera actress, and needs Alan to come along.  The problem is that Alan gets sick from Jake, so Charlie takes them to a steam room to help Alan get rid of his flu symptoms. This backfires, as Charlie also gets sick, but he has no intentions of canceling the date.

episodes.title: I Can't Afford Hyenas
episodes.overview: Stan, Charlie's accountant, tries to explain Charlie's financial woes to him.

episodes.title: Round One to the Hot Crazy Chick
episodes.overview: Against Alan's judgment, Charlie falls for a seemingly crazy woman named Frankie.

episodes.title: That Was Saliva, Alan
episodes.overview: Frankie tells Charlie and Alan why she and her daughter are on the run; Frankie's daughter has a crush on Jake.

episodes.title: Ate the Hamburgers, Wearing the Hats
episodes.overview: Alan offends Charlie by choosing harebrained cousins as Jake's guardians in the event of his death.

episodes.title: An Old Flame With a New Wick
episodes.overview: Charlie is stunned to learn his ex-girlfriend is now a man (Chris O'Donnell).

episodes.title: I Remember the Coatroom, I Just Don't Remember You
episodes.overview: Judith's sister, Liz (guest star Teri Hatcher), hits on Alan at Jake's birthday party; Evelyn prefers alcohol to cake.

episodes.title: Hey, I Can Pee Outside In the Dark
episodes.overview: Judith believes that Jake is having a hard time dealing with his parent's divorce, after he starts annoying everyone with his non-stop guitar playing. So she suggests that they send Jake to a therapist.  Alan doesn't agree at first, but after thinking about it, he believes it might not be such a bad idea.

episodes.title: No Sniffing, No Wowing
episodes.overview: Charlie jeopardizes Alan's divorce settlement by sleeping with his attorney, Laura.

episodes.title: My Doctor Has a Cow Puppet
episodes.overview: Charlie attempts to cure Alan of his recent bout of sleepwalking; Jake sees his therapist.

episodes.title: Just Like Buffalo
episodes.overview: Charlie tries to sweet talk Judith's divorcee support-group into letting Jake continue to spend weekends at his place.

episodes.title: Can You Feel My Finger?
episodes.overview: A pregnancy scare has Charlie heading to the doctor for a vasectomy.

episodes.title: Original Pilot - Most Chicks Won't Eat Veal
episodes.overview: In the original filming of the pilot Blythe Danner played Evelyn Harper, but due to her schedule she decided to drop out of the show and was later replaced by Holland Taylor.

episodes.title: Jennifer Taylor on Charlie Sheen, Jon Cryer Marriage Problems
Jon Cryer wins an Emmy for Two and a Half Men at the 2009 Primetime Emmy Awards
Two and a Half Men and CSI  - Behind the Scenes Cross Over
Two and a Half Men and CSI - Behind the Scenes Cross Over 2
